intro: Hypericum tubulosum, commonly known as the tubular St. John's wort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, woody stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a slightly hairy texture.
